com.microblink.recognizers.blinkid.croatia.combined

Class CroatianIDCombinedRecognizerSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microblink.recognizers.settings.RecognizerSettings
      • com.microblink.recognizers.blinkid.croatia.combined.CroatianIDCombinedRecognizerSettings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public class CroatianIDCombinedRecognizerSettings
extends RecognizerSettings
    Recognition Settings for combined reading of both front and back side of Croatian ID

    • Field Detail

      • FACE_IMAGE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String FACE_IMAGE_NAME
        Name of the image sent to MetadataListener that contains face. This image will be sent to MetadataListener during recognition process if displaying of face image is enabled (see setReturnFaceImage(boolean), and receiving of ImageType.DEWARPED image is enabled with MetadataSettings.ImageMetadataSettings.setDewarpedImageEnabled(boolean)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SIGNATURE_IMAGE_NAME

        public static final java.lang.String SIGNATURE_IMAGE_NAME
        Name of the image sent to MetadataListener that contains signature. This image will be sent to MetadataListener during recognition process if displaying of signature image is enabled (see setReturnSignatureImage(boolean), and receiving of ImageType.DEWARPED image is enabled with MetadataSettings.ImageMetadataSettings.setDewarpedImageEnabled(boolean)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FULL_DOCUMENT_IMAGE_FRONT

        public static final java.lang.String FULL_DOCUMENT_IMAGE_FRONT
        Name of the image sent to MetadataListener that contains full document front side. This image will be sent to MetadataListener during recognition process if displaying of full document image is enabled (see setReturnFullDocumentImage(boolean), and receiving of ImageType.DEWARPED image is enabled with MetadataSettings.ImageMetadataSettings.setDewarpedImageEnabled(boolean)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FULL_DOCUMENT_IMAGE_BACK

        public static final java.lang.String FULL_DOCUMENT_IMAGE_BACK
        Name of the image sent to MetadataListener that contains full document back side. This image will be sent to MetadataListener during recognition process if displaying of full document image is enabled (see setReturnFullDocumentImage(boolean), and receiving of ImageType.DEWARPED image is enabled with MetadataSettings.ImageMetadataSettings.setDewarpedImageEnabled(boolean)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CroatianIDCombinedRecognizerSettings

    • Method Detail

      • setReturnFaceImage

        public void setReturnFaceImage(boolean returnFaceImage)
        Sets whether face image from ID card should be sent to MetadataListener. If enabled, image will be of type ImageType.DEWARPED, and the name of the image (see Image.getImageName()) will be equal to FACE_IMAGE_NAME, so make sure you subscribe to receiving of ImageType.DEWARPED images with MetadataSettings.ImageMetadataSettings.setDewarpedImageEnabled(boolean)
        Parameters:
        returnFaceImage - whether face image should be sent to MetadataListener.

      • shouldReturnFaceImage

        public boolean shouldReturnFaceImage()
        Returns whether sending of face image from ID card to MetadataListener is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether sending of face image from ID card to MetadataListener is enabled.

      • setEncodeFaceImage

        public void setEncodeFaceImage(boolean encodeFaceImage)
        Sets whether face image from ID card should be encoded in JPEG format and written into the corresponding recognition result. By default encoding of image is disabled.
        IMPORTANT NOTE: Recognition result which contains encoded image cannot be parcelized and passed by Intent extras because of Android limitations on intent extras size. Passing large data objects through intent extras can cause application crash, depending on the device characteristics. Do not enable image encoding if you are using one of the provided scan activities and expect receiving of scan results as intent extras in Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent) method. In that case, use MetadataListener and setReturnFaceImage(boolean) to enable returning of face images.
        Parameters:
        encodeFaceImage - whether face image should be encoded in JPEG format and written into the corresponding recognition result.

      • shouldEncodeFaceImage

        public boolean shouldEncodeFaceImage()
        Returns whether encoding of face image from ID and writing it into the recognition result is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether encoding of face image from ID and writing it into the recognition result is enabled.

      • setReturnSignatureImage

        public void setReturnSignatureImage(boolean returnSignatureImage)
        Sets whether signature image from ID card should be sent to MetadataListener. If enabled, image will be of type ImageType.DEWARPED, and the name of the image (see Image.getImageName()) will be equal to SIGNATURE_IMAGE_NAME, so make sure you subscribe to receiving of ImageType.DEWARPED images with MetadataSettings.ImageMetadataSettings.setDewarpedImageEnabled(boolean)
        Parameters:
        returnSignatureImage - whether signature image should be sent to MetadataListener.

      • shouldReturnSignatureImage

        public boolean shouldReturnSignatureImage()
        Returns whether sending of signature image from ID card to MetadataListener is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether sending of signature image from ID card to MetadataListener is enabled.

      • setEncodeSignatureImage

        public void setEncodeSignatureImage(boolean encodeSignatureImage)
        Sets whether signature image from ID card should be encoded in JPEG format and written into the corresponding recognition result. By default encoding of image is disabled.
        IMPORTANT NOTE: Recognition result which contains encoded image cannot be parcelized and passed by Intent extras because of Android limitations on intent extras size. Passing large data objects through intent extras can cause application crash, depending on the device characteristics. Do not enable image encoding if you are using one of the provided scan activities and expect receiving of scan results as intent extras in Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent) method. In that case, use MetadataListener and setReturnSignatureImage(boolean) to enable returning of signature images.
        Parameters:
        encodeSignatureImage - whether signature image should be encoded in JPEG format and written into the corresponding recognition result.

      • shouldEncodeSignatureImage

        public boolean shouldEncodeSignatureImage()
        Returns whether encoding of signature image from ID and writing it into the recognition result is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether encoding of signature image from ID and writing it into the recognition result is enabled.

      • setReturnFullDocumentImage

        public void setReturnFullDocumentImage(boolean returnFullDocumentImage)
        Sets whether full document image should be sent to MetadataListener. If enabled, image will be of type ImageType.DEWARPED, and the name of the image (see Image.getImageName()) will be equal to FULL_DOCUMENT_IMAGE_FRONT or FULL_DOCUMENT_IMAGE_BACK (it depends on document side), so make sure you subscribe to receiving of ImageType.DEWARPED images with MetadataSettings.ImageMetadataSettings.setDewarpedImageEnabled(boolean)
        Parameters:
        returnFullDocumentImage - whether full document image should be sent to MetadataListener.

      • shouldReturnFullDocumentImage

        public boolean shouldReturnFullDocumentImage()
        Returns whether sending of full document image to MetadataListener is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether sending of full document image to MetadataListener is enabled.

      • setEncodeFullDocumentImag

        public void setEncodeFullDocumentImag(boolean encodeFullDocumentImage)
        Sets whether full document images from front and back side of the ID should be encoded in JPEG format and written into the corresponding recognition result. By default encoding of images is disabled.
        IMPORTANT NOTE: Recognition result which contains encoded images cannot be parcelized and passed by Intent extras because of Android limitations on intent extras size. Passing large data objects through intent extras can cause application crash, depending on the device characteristics. Do not enable images encoding if you are using one of the provided scan activities and expect receiving of scan results as intent extras in Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent) method. In that case, use MetadataListener and setReturnFullDocumentImage(boolean) to enable returning of full document images.
        Parameters:
        encodeFullDocumentImage - whether full document images should be encoded in JPEG format and written into the corresponding recognition result.

      • shouldEncodeFullDocumentImage

        public boolean shouldEncodeFullDocumentImage()
        Returns whether encoding of full document images from front and back side of the ID card and writing them into the recognition result is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether encoding of full document images from front and back side of the ID card and writing them into the recognition result is enabled.

      • writeToParcel

        public void writeToParcel(android.os.Parcel dest,
                          int flags)
